div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 07:15 am CDT

div.div: Areas of fog before 8am. Otherwise, partly sunny, with a high near 69. Calm wind becoming south 5 to 7 mph in the afternoon.
Scattered showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy, with a low around 54. East wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%.
Showers. High near 61. Northeast wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%.

h3.a: Iuka Grade School Slates Public Hearing

div.p: Iuka Grade School District CCSD #7 Board of Education will hold a public hearing on Wednesday, December 18, 2019 at 7:00PM in the Iuka Grade School Library. The purpose of the public hearing is to satisfy the legal requirements prior to approval of a request for a modification to the Illinois School Code regarding a waiver to allow non-resident children of full-time employees to attend Iuka CCSD #7 free of charge.

a.aria-label: Read more about Iuka Grade School Slates Public Hearing

h3.a: IGS Earns "Exemplary" Designation From State Board of Education

div.p:
Iuka Grade School is pleased to announce that we have received a rating of "Exemplary", the highest rating given, from the Illinois State Board of Education on our 2018 School Report Card.
The designation is based on PARCC scores, Student Growth (4-8th Grades), English Language progress and proficiency (1-8th Grades), and Attendance.
Iuka Grade School is committed to providing a rigorous and challenging curriculum that . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about IGS Earns "Exemplary" Designation From State Board of Education

div.p:
We had a great start to the Summer Library Program today with 23 kids showing up!
Remember, the Summer Library Program is every Tuesday from 9:30AM to 10:30AM! (This is a time change)
Students will have the opportunity to check out books, listen to books read aloud, do a craft, and have a small snack.
Hope to see YOU next Tuesday for Summer Library!

a.aria-label: Read more about IGS Summer Library Program

div.p: On Monday, March 3 some of our bus routes will be changing. This will mean that your child may have a new driver and/or have a new pick-up/drop-off time. Some of the pick-up and drop-off times may change anywhere from 10-15 minutes. The recent changes in drop-off times for the students riding the town bus will remain the same. If you have questions about whether there will be changes in your child’s driver and/or pick-up/drop-off times, please contact the bus contractor, Bill Linder at 780-7350. For any other questions, please call the school’s . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Some Bus Routes Changing

h3.a: History of the Iuka Grade School

div.h4: Written and Edited by Kenneth E. Beaver and David L. Hock
div.p:
As early as 1841, education was available in the luka township, for those children whose parents could afford to pay. It was during this year that Cynthia Cooper, the first teacher in the Iuka community, conducted classes in a "select school” which was held in a log cabin at String Town. The first schoolhouse, which had been previously used as a dwelling, was purchased for school purposes by District No. 2. This building was made of split logs, 16xl8 feet. The first person to be hired to teach there was T. W. H. Miller.
The first building built . . .
